res.content_title: Executive Function: Building systems that can make decisions without you | Jeanne DeWitt Grosser (COO, Vercel)
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed extensively as Jeanne's previous employer where she spent nearly a decade. Multiple examples of leadership, scaling challenges, executive team dynamics, and business operations are drawn from her Stripe experience.

res.content_title: Bridge CEO Zach Abrams: Stablecoins Are The Next Platform for Money
res.tag_context: Stripe is extensively discussed as Bridge's acquirer and as a key player in stablecoin adoption. The conversation covers Stripe's strategic acquisitions (Bridge, Privy), their Tempo blockchain project, and their approach to enabling stablecoin payments with lower interchange fees.

res.content_title: Betting an Entire Company on AI, Bubble or Not | Render CEO Anurag Goel
res.tag_context: Stripe features prominently in Anurag's career journey, from being an early customer (when it was called Dev Payments) to becoming employee number eight. His experience there shaped his approach to developer productivity and infrastructure, directly influencing his later founding of Render.

res.content_title: Alex Rampell on Venture at Scale and Founder Incentives
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed as a major missed investment opportunity by Rampell, who passed on the seed round when it was called Dev Payments. The company was used as an example of studying payment system history and building better products for new companies.

res.content_title: 20VC: a16z's $15BN Fundraise with Alex Rampell | The Best Companies Have Hostages Not Customers | The Best Founders Materialise Capital, Customers and Labour | Mid-Sized Funds with Die and The Future of Venture Capital
res.series_name: The Twenty Minute VC (20VC): Venture Capital | Startup Funding | The Pitch
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed as a key example of Alex's investment philosophy, including his decision to pass on the early rounds (when it was called Dev Payments) and the lessons learned about studying payment system history. The company illustrates the 'Greenfield Bingo' investment thesis.

res.content_title: Landmark Regulation, ICOs, Downtober & Privacy: 2025 Crypto Year in Review (Part 2) - Ep. 991
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed in connection with Tempo becoming its own L1 blockchain, with debate about how committed Stripe actually is to this project versus it being just one of many bets they're making in the crypto space.

res.content_title: Real time features, AI search, Agentic similarities
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed as a key collaboration partner in developing and open-sourcing Cronon before its public release. The partnership lasted 6-8 months and helped battle-test the platform at scale in another payments company context.

res.content_title: Big Ideas 2026: New Infrastructure Primitives
res.tag_context: Stripe was used as a key example of the greenfield strategy, where they sold to startups at formation and grew with them as those customers became large enterprises.

res.content_title: Do Revenue and Margins Still Matter in AI?
res.tag_context: Discussed as a successful portfolio company that exemplifies the benefits of staying private longer, with John Collison's perspective on avoiding public market pressures mentioned.

res.content_title: 20VC: a16z's David George on How $BN Funds Can 5×, Do Margins & Revenue Matter in AI & the Most Controversial Bet at a16z
res.series_name: The Twenty Minute VC (20VC): Venture Capital | Startup Funding | The Pitch
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed as a portfolio company that benefits from staying private longer, with John Collison quoted about avoiding public market pressures. It's used as an example of companies with easy access to private capital.

res.content_title: Crypto's Killer App?
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed as the acquirer of Bridge and as a major player enabling stablecoin infrastructure. The conversation covers the acquisition rationale, integration challenges, and Stripe's role in accelerating Bridge's growth.

res.content_title: Building Flex, the AI Private Bank with CEO Zaid Rahman
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed in two contexts: first as the infrastructure Flex initially used for their credit card product before building their own stack, and later as an example of a successful multi-product fintech company with various entry points for customers.

res.content_title: The future of AI-powered sales with Vercel COO, Jeanne DeWitt
res.tag_context: Stripe is heavily discussed as Gene's previous company where she built the early sales team from the ground up. Multiple examples are shared about Stripe's go-to-market strategies, including their whiteboarding approach, marketplace focus, and segmentation frameworks.

res.content_title: A guide to difficult conversations, building high-trust teams, and designing a life you love | Rachel Lockett
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed as Rachel's former workplace where she worked as an HR business partner and created programs for top executives. The company was also mentioned for its hiring practices and as an example of successful business operations.

res.content_title: Satya Nadella describes how lessons from Microsoft’s history apply to today’s boom
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed as a collaboration partner with Microsoft on agentic commerce initiatives, with detailed conversation about building payment infrastructure for AI-driven commerce experiences. The discussion includes Stripe's business model evolution and approach to serving startups and enterprises.

res.content_title: Inside Stripe: Stablecoins, AI, and (not) Going Public | Will Gaybrick, President of Technology and Business at Stripe
res.tag_context: Stripe is the primary focus of the entire conversation, with extensive discussion of its products, strategy, AI initiatives, stablecoin efforts, financial performance, and business operations. The guest Will Gaybrick is President of Technology and Business at Stripe.

res.content_title: a16z's State of Crypto: The $4 Trillion Milestone and What's Next'
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed as a key catalyst for institutional crypto adoption, particularly through their acquisition of Bridge and their development of the Tempo blockchain project. The hosts identified Stripe's moves as the 'starting gun' for broader institutional interest in stablecoins.

res.content_title: The Stablecoin Chain Wars: Codex’s Bet on On-Chain FX | Cofounder Haonan Li
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed as a major competitor through its Tempo blockchain initiative. The conversation analyzes Stripe's approach to payments infrastructure and neutrality concerns for competitors using Stripe's chain.

res.content_title: Stablecoin special: Zach Abrams (Bridge) and Henri Stern (Privy)
res.tag_context: Stripe acquired both Bridge and Privy and is discussed as the acquiring company. The conversation covers Stripe's M&A strategy, integration challenges, and how the acquisitions fit into Stripe's broader crypto and payments strategy.

res.content_title: How the Competition Will Play Out in the Great Stablecoin Race - Ep. 936
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed extensively in relation to Tempo's stablecoin chain, with analysis of how Stripe's distribution capabilities could benefit Tempo while potentially creating conflicts with other payment service providers.

res.content_title: The Agents Economy Backbone - with Emily Glassberg Sands, Head of Data & AI at Stripe
res.series_name: Latent Space: The AI Engineer Podcast
res.tag_context: Stripe is the primary focus of the entire conversation, with Emily Sands discussing her role as Head of Data & AI at Stripe, the company's financial infrastructure services, AI initiatives, fraud detection systems, and various products like Radar, Link, and the Agentic Commerce Protocol.

res.content_title: How Figma Scales Freemium to Enterprise
res.tag_context: Stripe is used as a detailed case study example of customer expansion, having been a Figma customer since 2019 and growing their usage over 200 times, now using Figma across product, brand, and website design.

res.content_title: State of Crypto 2025: The Latest Data, Trends, and Themes Revealed
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed as a key catalyst for institutional crypto adoption, particularly through their acquisition of Bridge and their development of the Tempo project and acquisition of Privy for wallet infrastructure.

res.content_title: The Chopping Block: Zcash +400%, Tempo’s $500M Shock, EF Pay Firestorm & AWS/Base Meltdown feat. Mert - Ep. 929
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed as Tempo's key incubator and strategic partner, with its fintech credentials lending credibility to Tempo's $5B valuation. The discussion highlighted how Stripe's involvement differentiates Tempo from other L1 projects.

res.content_title: Dan Sundheim of D1 Capital on the art of public market investing
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed both as a D1 investment and as an example of why companies might avoid going public due to market volatility issues. Sundheim explained his underwriting process for Stripe based on his financial services background.

res.content_title: Could BTC Outperform Gold? Plus, Ethereum's Big Advantage: Bits + Bips - Ep. 928
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed as the backer of Tempo and a major player entering the stablecoin and payments space. The hosts questioned whether other payment companies would adopt Stripe's blockchain solution given competitive dynamics.

res.content_title: Elad Gil Explains Why 90% of Startups Fail in Every Tech Cycle
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed extensively as one of Gil's key investments, used as an example of a company that may remain forever private, and compared to Braintree to illustrate long-term vs short-term durability in startups.

res.content_title: Bits + Bips: What’s Really Driving Bitcoin—and Who’s Driving Crypto Onchain? - Ep. 919
res.tag_context: Stripe was analyzed as a major player in the 'Onchain 5' for their Tempo blockchain initiative and Bridge acquisition. Discussion focused on their strategy to vertically integrate blockchain technology into payments processing and their potential to launch stablecoins for merchants.

res.content_title: Uncapped #27 | Vince Hankes from Thrive Capital
res.tag_context: Stripe is featured as a key case study of Thrive's investment approach, including the $2 billion investment during a challenging market period and the long-term relationship spanning nearly 10 years.

res.content_title: Tobi Lütke is still captivated by internet commerce, 20 years later
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed extensively as Shopify's long-term partner, with detailed exploration of their 13-year relationship, technical integration, and collaborative work on stablecoins and payments infrastructure. The partnership is highlighted as a rare example of successful tech company collaboration.

res.content_title: Best AI Hackathon Project Ever? [Bit Size Episode]
res.tag_context: Stripe was mentioned as providing access to a new one-time payments card feature in private beta. The team had a late-night call with Stripe to integrate this payment solution for secure transactions in their travel booking agent.

res.content_title: Can advance market commitments jumpstart climate’s hardest sectors?
res.tag_context: Stripe was credited as one of the pioneers of the Frontier carbon removal AMC, working alongside Lower Carbon Capital's partner Nan Ransohoff to develop this market mechanism.

res.content_title: ROLLUP: Uptober Rally | Tom Lee $1B ETH Buy | Vanguard Flips to Crypto | Stripe Stablecoin Play
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed for launching their Bridge infrastructure and Open Issuance platform that allows companies to easily create their own stablecoins. The hosts analyzed how this could disrupt the Tether-Circle duopoly by enabling wallets and exchanges to issue their own stablecoins.

res.content_title: MCP Servers: Teaching AI to Use the Internet Like Humans
res.tag_context: Stripe serves as the primary example throughout the conversation for explaining APIs, MCP servers, and business automation scenarios. Alex's previous work at Stripe on their API is also discussed as relevant background.

res.content_title: Why Every Company Will Have a Stablecoin — and Why One L2 Isn’t Enough - Ep. 912
res.tag_context: Stripe is extensively discussed as the acquirer of Bridge and as a major player in the payments space. The conversation covers Stripe's crypto strategy, their blockchain Tempo, and how Bridge fits into their broader ecosystem of products including Privy.

res.content_title: Cheeky Pint: Marc Andreessen, John Collison & Charlie Songhurst on Tech’s Big Questions
res.tag_context: Stripe is extensively discussed as John Collison's company, with detailed analysis of its business model, growth trajectory, and role in the AI economy. The conversation covers Stripe's approach to building technology infrastructure and its relationship with VCs.

res.content_title: Marc Andreessen and Charlie Songhurst on the past, present, and future of Silicon Valley
res.tag_context: Charlie Songhurst's company was discussed in detail regarding its business model, growth strategy, board dynamics, and role in building economic infrastructure for AI companies and crypto payments.

res.content_title: Des Traynor on reinventing Intercom twice and the “four horsemen” of good AI companies
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed in relation to its billing and payment processing capabilities, particularly in the context of usage-based pricing for AI companies. The conversation also touches on Stripe's product strategy and growth.

res.content_title: 20VC: General Catalyst CEO Hemant Taneja on The Future of Venture Capital: Chanel vs Walmart | Lessons Scaling GC to $40BN in AUM | Investing $5BN+ Into Stripe Over 14 Rounds | Investing Hundreds of Millions into Anthropic at $60BN Valuation
res.series_name: The Twenty Minute VC (20VC): Venture Capital | Startup Funding | The Pitch
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed multiple times as a key investment for General Catalyst. Hemant mentions investing in Stripe 14 times over 15 years, with a total investment of over $5 billion. He sees Stripe as potentially becoming a trillion-dollar company in the future.

res.content_title: Debate: Should Stablecoin Chains Have an Ethereum L2 or Their Own L1? - Ep. 907
res.tag_context: Stripe's Tempo blockchain was discussed as an example of a company building its own L1 for stablecoins. The debate touched on Stripe's motivations and the potential implications for the stablecoin ecosystem.

res.content_title: The Chopping Block: Stablecoin-as-a-Service: The Next Big Crypto Gold Rush? - Ep. 906
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed in relation to their involvement in the Tempo blockchain project and their entry into the stablecoin market with USDB. The conversation explored how Stripe's move could impact the stablecoin landscape.

res.content_title: Ambrook CEO Mackenzie Burnett on American agriculture, rural resilience, and carrying 50lbs of fresh pork on Amtrak
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed extensively as the infrastructure provider for Ambrook's financial services. The conversation explores Stripe's role in enabling embedded finance, its strategy for transcending traditional financial systems, and its potential to shape the future of financial infrastructure.

res.content_title: FinTech Meets Crypto: The Future of Global Payments | Simon Taylor
res.tag_context: Stripe is frequently mentioned as the sponsor and investor behind Tempo. The discussion explores how Stripe's involvement in blockchain technology through Tempo represents a significant shift in the fintech industry's approach to crypto.

res.content_title: Rollup Roundup with Gelato, L2Beat, Succinct, and Spire | Livestream
res.tag_context: Stripe's decision to launch their own L1 chain (Tempo) rather than an Ethereum L2 was a major discussion point throughout the podcast. The speakers analyzed why Stripe chose this path and what it means for Ethereum's rollup ecosystem.

res.content_title: Stripe’s Trillion-Dollar Bet: How Stablecoins Eat Global Payments | Founder of Bridge Zach Abrams
res.tag_context: Stripe is the primary focus of the conversation, discussing its acquisition of Bridge, its move into stablecoins and crypto, and its role in the future of fintech. The company's crypto transformation and potential impact on the financial industry are extensively explored.

res.content_title: ROLLUP: ETH Hits All Time High, But Will It Stick?
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed in relation to Tempo, a new blockchain project incubated by Stripe and Paradigm. The conversation covered the design and features of Tempo, including its focus on payments and stablecoins.

res.content_title: #58 - Miles Grimshaw
res.tag_context: Stripe is discussed multiple times as an example of Thrive Capital's investments. It's used to illustrate the growth potential of companies and the importance of long-term vision in investing.

res.content_title: Two VCs on Why the 4-Year Cycle Is Dead, DATs & Hyperliquid vs. Binance - Ep. 892
res.tag_context: Stripe was discussed in the context of its potential entry into the stablecoin market with Tempo. Its existing distribution and customer base were highlighted as potential advantages in the stablecoin space.

res.content_title: The Stablecoin Playbook for TradFi Ft. Sam Broner
res.tag_context: Stripe was mentioned multiple times in the context of building its own blockchain for stablecoins. The discussion focused on Stripe's potential strategy to cut out middlemen and reduce costs in payment processing.

res.content_title: Markets Are Up, Stablecoins, and Corporate Chains | Livestream
res.tag_context: Stripe was a major focus of discussion regarding their announcement to launch their own L1 blockchain for payments. The hosts analyzed Stripe's competitive advantages due to their existing merchant integrations and debated whether they would launch a token, comparing their approach to other companies entering the blockchain payments space.
